intro: Pterandra sericea, commonly known as the silky pterandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and small, ovate leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery hair. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are typically followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
